creator: marc.saegesser@apropos.com
text:
Tomcat is sending a redirect to the welcome file instead of serving directly in 
response to the request.  The servlet 2.2 specification (which Tomcat 3.x 
implements) is almost completely silent on how welcome files are handled.  The 
2.3 Proposed Final Draft specification provides more detail.  The relevant item 
may be that it states that the request should be 'forwarded' to the matching 
resource.  That could be interpreted to preclude using a redirect.

Any any event, this won't get changed for Tomcat 3.2.2.  I'll leave the bug 
report open so that if the specification gets clarified we can change the 
behaviour in the future.

creator: cmanolache@yahoo.com
text: The current behavior is correct ( from spec point of view ). The redirect is important since it gives the right paths to the welcome page, if it is dynamic - and it's result of various bugs found in jasper. It would be easy to change, but this will add complexity and is likely to brake other templating systems.
